entry.title: Manual exchange rate when clearing 2 open items one in EUR and one in MAD
entry.content:
Hello Experts!!

For a bank GL account managed in MAD (local currency), I need to clear 2 open items : Item 1 with posting date 31122024 in MAD currency, Item 2 with posting date 28022025 in EUR currency. In FBL3N the difference between the two posts is of 0,24 MAD.

Now the business need to clear these two posts with today's date (the system uses today as exchange date), but the difference we have in FBL3N is not the same in F-03 (259 MAD in F-03). Is there a way to allow business use the exchange rate of 28.02.2025 instead of today's date or let them type a manual exchange ?

I tried FIORI app F1579 et F-04 but seem don't cover this need. 022025 period is closed.

Thank you in advance!!!

entry.title: Withholding Tax is calculated on payments and Downpayment Separately
entry.content:
Hi Team,

 

I hope you’re doing well.

 

We’re encountering an inconsistency in withholding tax calculation:

 

  •  

  • Threshold rule: For amounts up to ₹X→ 0% tax. For amounts above → 10% tax.

  •  

  • The down‑payments from vendors are being taxed separately and not aggregated with full payment amounts.

  •  

  • In contrast, regular invoice payments follow the correct threshold logic.

 

This discrepancy between down‑payments and invoice payments is causing incorrect tax deductions.

 

Could you please advise on:

 

  1.  

  2. Correct configuration for threshold-based tax accumulation across both payment types?

  3.  

  4. Settings or transaction keys to ensure down‑payments and invoices are treated in a single accumulation cycle?

  5.  

  6. Any known workarounds or patches to align the behavior?

 

Your guidance on aligning the issue across both transaction types would be greatly appreciated.

 

Thanks in advance for your support!

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Posting failed: Unable to post using posting rule F020 – Bill of Exchange Payable.
entry.content:
Dear expert,

I attempted to create a manual bank statement and selected F020 (Bill of Exchange Payable) as the manual transaction in one of the line items. According to the SAP Help Portal, this posting rule is classified as a one-step posting, meaning it should only affect the bank ledger.

However, upon clicking the Post button, the following information message appeared:

Message: Statement posted: 0 items completed, 1 item not completed

No error or warning messages were displayed within the bank statement itself, so I’m unclear why the posting could not be completed successfully.

Could you kindly advise on the cause or necessary action?

Thank you in advance for your support.

Best regards, 

HY

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Finance   FIN (Finance)

entry.title: Defining Exchange Rate Types (Buying/Selling) and Automatically Applying them in Billing /Loc Turkey
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

in Turkey its a legel requirement to have to Exchange Rate Types for Buying and Selling.

In my S/4HANA Cloud system, I have created two custom exchange rate types:

  • ZTCB_B for Forex Buying rates

  • ZTCB_S for Forex Selling rates

I defined them via Manage Your Solution → Define Exchange Rate Types (SSCUI 101021) and then set up 1:1 currency pairs under Define Exchange Rate Type Distribution (SSCUI 101022).

Now I need the system to automatically pick the correct exchange rate type (ZTCB_B or ZTCB_S) when I generate customer invoices—without any manual overrides in the billing document.

  1. Which Fiori app or SSCUI step controls the “Pricing Exchange Rate Type” used for the SD pricing condition (field VBRP-KURSK) in billing?

  2. Are there any additional copy-control, document-type, or FI-side configuration steps required to ensure my custom rate types are consistently applied in all billing and FI postings?

I’m looking for the exact Fiori apps (or SSCUI IDs) and the relevant fields to configure. Any pointers or configuration screenshots would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: How to achieve auto clearing of Vendor down payment through F110 without using F-54?
entry.content:
Hello Community!
I am using SAP ECC EHP8, I want to achieve below process in my system, please guide how I can achieve this.

Step 1: Made a vendor down payment request through F-47 amounting $85000.
Step 2: Made a payment of this down payment request through F110.
Step 3: Made a Invoice of same vendor amounting $100000.
Step 4: Want to make a payment through F110 in which APP knocks off down payment amounting $85000 with Invoice amounting $100000 and make a payment of $15000.

Currently, F110 not auto knocking off down payment with Invoice, unless I clear down payment through F-54. I see in multiple posts this can be achievable with the configuration in FBZP.

I done this configuration but still not working.

Kindly assist what I am missing or I am doing wrong.
Thank You.

entry.title: Gravação dos campos XREF1, XREF2 e XREF3 de cobrança Itaú CNB400
entry.content:
Boa tarde comunidade.

Estou importando o arquivo de retorno de cobrança do Itaú, referente meio pagamento boleto mas não está gravando o NOSSO NUMERO no campo XREF3 no documento e já fiz um check de  toda a configuração na OT51 e está tudo correto( Oper.Ext:-->02,  Regra Contabil:--B02D, Algoritimo de Interpretação:-->30 -030- Pesquisa Brasileira vai BELNR, GJAHR  e BUZEI, Tipo de Processamento:-->11- Brasil:entrada de documentos com dados brasileiros), na OB41, OB14 e td ok. O único fato é que o boleto é emitido pela empresa e não pelo banco.

Alguém saberia me dizer porque não grava os dados nos campos? Devo implementar uma Exit pra fazer isso?

Fico muito grato se alguém puder me ajudar.

Sayan Kayal

entry.content:
I have run MT940 and all lines were red. Some subledger postings were completed and posted but no bank postings were completed. I ran RFEBKA90 but this changed the status to posted. How do I revert this?

My thoughts are

1, Reverse the subledger postings.

2. Delete the statement

3. Re-run the bank statement upload

 

Any ideas?

entry.title: Manual Bank Statement Processing with Unknown Bank Charges – Need for Flexible Clearing Logic
entry.content:
Description:

Dear SAP Support,

We are facing a challenge during manual bank statement processing in SAP S/4HANA (FICO module). In our business scenario, we receive customer payments against invoices—for example, an invoice of 1000. At the time of receiving the payment (before the actual bank deposit), we post the following entry: Debit Incoming Clearing Account (Temporary) 1000 and Credit Customer Account 1000. However, when the actual bank statement arrives the next day, it shows that only 900 was deposited into our bank account, and the remaining 100 was deducted as bank charges.

 

We want to reflect this correctly in the manual bank statement posting. Specifically, the desired accounting entries during manual bank statement posting should be: (1) Debit Main Bank Account 900 and Credit Technical Clearing Account 900, and (2) Debit Technical Clearing Account 900, Debit Bank Charges 100, and Credit Incoming Clearing Account 1000. This allows us to record the actual bank deposit, account for the bank charges as an expense, and fully clear the Incoming Clearing Account for 1000.

 

Ideally, we want the system to automatically post the difference between the incoming amount (1000) and the bank credited amount (900) to a Bank Charges G/L account during manual bank statement posting. This should happen even when the deducted amount is not known in advance or follows no fixed percentage rule.

 

The issue we are facing is that during manual bank statement posting (“Manage Incoming Bank Statement” app in Public Cloud), 

 

Additionally, the major complexity is that we do not know the exact percentage or amount of bank charges in advance. The amount deducted by the bank varies case by case, so it is not feasible to automate this logic using fixed interpretation algorithms or rules. Due to this, we need a flexible mechanism that allows us to manually enter the actual deposit amount, and the system should automatically calculate and post the difference to the Bank Charges account while still clearing the full incoming amount.

Best regards,
Ahsan Ali
SAP FICO Consultant

entry.title: BoE – AP: Why Can’t We Set Maturity Date per Supplier Master ?
entry.content:
Dear expert, 

I’m reaching out to seek clarification regarding the handling of Bills of Exchange (BoE) due dates (maturity dates) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition).

Based on our testing and the SAP Knowledge Base Article [2837406 – Due Date in Manage Automatic Payments for BOE Outgoing Payments], we understand that the BoE due date can either be manually entered during the automatic payment run or derived from the invoice due date, depending on the configuration setup shown in the KBA above. 

However, in our case, BoE maturity terms (e.g., 45, 60, or 90 days) are typically defined in individual supplier contracts and therefore differ from one vendor to another. As these terms are vendor-specific and contractually agreed, it would be both practical and efficient to maintain the BoE maturity term directly within the supplier master data. Doing so would enable the system to automatically apply the correct maturity during BoE processing, ensuring consistency and minimizing manual input.

Therefore, I would like to understand why SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition) does not currently support storing BoE maturity terms per supplier in the supplier master.

I kindly request your support in addressing the following:

  • Could you clarify why the system does not allow BoE maturity terms (e.g., 60 days) to be maintained per supplier?

  • Are there any planned enhancements in this area, or possible workarounds (such as using custom fields or extensibility features)?

  • What are the recommended best practices for handling BoE AP in scenarios where maturity terms are supplier-specific?

Your guidance on this matter would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support.

Best regards,
HY

entry.title: Where are exchange rates actually used in business processes (FI, MM, SD)?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’ve successfully configured the automatic exchange rate import via the MRM module.
Now I’m trying to better understand where exactly these rates are applied in real business processes.

I’m aware that FI, MM, and SD (and possibly other modules) are impacted.
However, I’m still looking for concrete use cases or documentation that describe how and where the exchange rate is used – for example, in sales documents, purchase orders, or billing. I’d like to include a clear use case for all Moduls in our group-wide rollout showing where exchange rates impact business processes in SAP.

Is there a clear overview, real-life example, or detailed explanation of which transactions or document types rely on exchange rates?

Thanks a lot in advance and best regards,
Simon

entry.title: Can S-price materials not be posted to UMB when running MR22?
entry.content:

When S-price materials execute MR22, when the material value is increased, the debit account is PRD and the credit account is UMB

I can only set PRD FRT by setting the reason, but cannot change UMB. I want to post the account to UMB FRT instead of UMB. Is it possible? Best Regards

Chen
